intro: Salsola camphorosmoides, commonly known as desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in desert environments. The plant features small, green to grayish leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss, and it produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Salsola camphorosmoides is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions, making it a common component of desert vegetation. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
